htmlEmbed:
The Privacy That DeFi Needs to SucceedCoinDesk0/27/2022

Mainstream adoption of DeFi tools will require far more secrecy, but not too much secrecy, and the right sort of secrecy, says CoinDesk columnist J.P. Koning. This post is part of CoinDesk's Privacy Week.

theme weeks, Privacy Week, Privacy, DeFi, OpinionArchivedRead

class="author-blockstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1t3hl0h-0 hZraPE"><div class="at-author-block layout-column"><div><div><a href="/author/JPKoning/"><div class="img-wrapper"><img src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/arc-authors/coindesk/ef1d5f94-d38a-4b2d-b087-e0cf7f5f7114.jpeg" alt="CoinDesk - Unknown" loading="lazy"/></div></a></div><div><div class="name"><p class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 kzGyYF"><a href="/author/JPKoning/">JP Koning</a></p></div></div></div><div><div class="description"><p class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bZvpZH">J.P. Koning, a CoinDesk columnist, worked as an equity researcher at a Canadian brokerage firm and a financial writer at a large Canadian bank. He runs the popular Moneyness blog.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div><div><div class="contentstyle__StyledWrapper-g5cdrh-0 gCDWPA"><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>The transparency of blockchains is often marketed as a benefit. It's not. Main Street financial consumers are never going to adopt blockchain-based financial tools as long as blockchains are radically transparent. Regular folks have secrets that they want to keep.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>One of the most promising use cases for blockchains is decentralized finance (<a href="https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-defi/" target="_blank/">DeFi</a>). The people who are building DeFi tools aspire for DeFi to be something more than a skate park for the risk-loving crypto-rich. They want their tools to solve real-world financial problems faced by individuals and companies, including America's 31.7 million small businesses.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p><i><b>This article is part of CoinDesk's </b></i><a href="http://coindesk.com/layer2/privacyweek"><i><b>Privacy Week</b></i></a><i><b> series. J.P. Koning, a CoinDesk columnist, worked as an equity researcher at a Canadian brokerage firm and a financial writer at a large Canadian bank. He runs the popular Moneyness blog.</b></i></p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>Imagine a cash-starved manufacturer in Toledo, Ohio, that has a good idea for a product. It could go to its banker for financing, but instead it turns to DeFi. In a jiffy, it tokenizes a bunch of receivables onto a blockchain and lodges them as collateral on a decentralized lending platform in return for U.S. dollar <a href="https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-a-stablecoin/" target="_blank/">stablecoins</a>. A few moments later, it swaps these dollars for Euro stablecoins using a decentralized exchange, sending them to its French supplier to purchase inventory.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>This chain of transactions has the promise of being cheap, fast and avoiding the walled garden of regular banks. Unfortunately, our Toledo manufacturer probably wont bother.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>All blockchain transactions are public by default. The government, your competitors and your mother can all see what you are doing. Blockchain analytics firms like Chainalysis and CipherTrace make it their business to track, analyze and interpret every trade and transaction.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>Secrecy is vital to commerce. Not only is it important for businesses to protect the privacy of their customers, they must also keep their competitors in the dark lest their long-term strategy be divined and countered or copied. Our Toledo manufacturer doesnt want its intentions to be telegraphed by their on-chain financial preparations.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>As for individuals, they don't want their friends and colleagues to know what their salary is, or what kinds of porn they're purchasing. No one wants to be doxxed. We like our secrets.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>Bricks-and-mortar finance is already capable of providing the secrecy that Main Street requires. Individuals and corporations generally trust their old-school bankers not to reveal information about their financial dealings to others. It's not quite cash-level anonymity. Yes, there are leaks and hacks. And under certain conditions, a banker must disclose information to law enforcement. But in general, Main Street trusts the confidentiality and probity of their financial provider.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>So if Main Street users are ever going to migrate over to DeFi, privacy will have to be built first. But not just any privacy.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p><a href="https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2022/01/25/tornado-cash-co-founder-says-the-mixer-protocol-is-unstoppable/">Tornado Cash</a> has become the DeFi world's go-to tool for achieving anonymity. A user can send funds to a Tornado Cash <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/smart-contracts.asp" target="_blank">smart contract</a> where it gets mixed up and obfuscated with other people's funds. Later, that user can surreptitiously withdraw the same amount of money to a separate address. A technology called <a href="https://www.coindesk.com/tag/zk-snarks/" target="_blank/">zk-SNARKs</a> is used to reduce the ability of third parties to trace funds through Tornado.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>Unfortunately, Tornado Cash has become a popular venue for thieves to clean stolen funds. The presence of criminals will make Main Street businesses like our Toledo-based manufacturer hesitate. Depositing company funds into a Tornado Cash smart contract may be construed as mixing them with criminally-derived funds. That's probably not the sort of money laundering risk that licit money wants to take.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>The best solution for bringing privacy to DeFi is native anonymity. That is, all blockchain transactions have to be opaque by default. That way, Main Street users get the privacy they require without having to take the risk of jumbling up their coins with crooks. (Approaches like the Aztec Network, a privacy layer implemented on top of the base <a href="https://www.coindesk.com/learn/how-does-ethereum-work/" target="_blank/">Ethereum</a> layer, might be a solution.)</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>While native anonymity would solve Main Street's very real need for secrecy, it will lead to the next hurdle to widespread adoption: too much anonymity.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>If a Main Street financial user like our Toledo manufacturer can't risk tumbling their coins with dirty money on Tornado Cash, neither can they risk commingling their funds on decentralized exchanges or lending tools that grant unconditional access to everyone, including thieves' dirty funds.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>To make their tools palatable for Main Street, DeFi tool makers will have to unwind some of the native anonymity (potentially) afforded by blockchains by collecting and verifying identifying information from users. This way the tools can screen out criminals, assuring legitimate businesses that their clean funds aren't being tainted by dirty money.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p><i><b>Read more: </b></i><a href="https://www.coindesk.com/layer2/privacyweek/2022/01/27/before-you-click-i-agree-how-binance-coinbase-and-22-other-crypto-exchanges-handle-your-data/" target="_blank/"><i><b>How Binance, Coinbase and 22 Other Crypto Exchanges Handle Your Data</b></i></a></p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>The implication is that DeFi tools will have to become privacy managers, just like old-school banks are. Users will have to trust the tools to be discreet with their personal information, only breaking their privacy when certain conditions are required, such as law enforcement requests.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>Its possible that DeFi succeeds in doing a better job of preserving privacy than traditional financial institutions. By using <a href="https://www.coindesk.com/layer2/privacyweek/2022/01/24/the-trojan-horse-of-privacy/">zero-knowledge proofs</a> for collecting identity, DeFi tools may be able to control the spray of personal information required to gain access. This may reduce the amount of information that gets lost to hacks.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>In sum, if DeFi wants to attract Main Street users, an odd mix of more secrecy and less secrecy is required. Secrecy is important to businesses and individuals. They dont want their information to be naked for all to see. But Main Street doesn't want complete anonymity. It wants to use DeFi tools that strip away just enough secrets to assure that dirty money is being excluded.</p></div></div><div class="common-textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-18pd49k-0 eSbCkN"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 bYmaON at-text"><p>Only when this balance has been achieved will businesses like our Toledo, Ohio, manufacturer venture onto the blockchain.</p></div></div></div><div class="Box-sc-1hpkeeg-0"><hr class="divider__StyledDivider-sc-149ljp0-0 dcwNIV"/><div class="Box-sc-1hpkeeg-0 dcgof"><h6 class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 kzGyYF">Read more about</h6></div><div display="flex" class="Box-sc-1hpkeeg-0 hnmRHq"><a class="article-tagsstyles__TagPill-sc-16peqf0-0 jqziSB light" type="application/javascript">window.Fusion=window.Fusion||{};Fusion.arcSite="coindesk";Fusion.contextPath="/pf";Fusion.deployment="177";Fusion.globalContent={"content":{"type":"story","_id":"3H2PI2L5UBBOLFCT44UBFFFN6E","website_url":"/layer2/privacyweek/2022/01/27/the-privacy-that-defi-needs-to-succeed/","canonical_url":"/layer2/privacyweek/2022/01/27/the-privacy-that-defi-needs-to-succeed/","content_elements":[{"_id":"7WVRZX5LOJABTJWHLWO7ABB7LM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089489,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The transparency of blockchains is often marketed as a benefit. It's not. Main Street financial consumers are never going to adopt blockchain-based financial tools as long as blockchains are radically transparent. Regular folks have secrets that they want to keep."},{"_id":"S5MQ5FNTKBFE3L7KI34J3A65XE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089490,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"One of the most promising use cases for blockchains is decentralized finance (<a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-defi/\" target=\"_blank\">DeFi</a>). The people who are building DeFi tools aspire for DeFi to be something more than a skate park for the risk-loving crypto-rich. They want their tools to solve real-world financial problems faced by individuals and companies, including America's 31.7 million small businesses."},{"_id":"6RGVEVQFRNFQTPT7V5JFWUP6HM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089491,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>This article is part of CoinDesk's </b></i><a href=\"http://coindesk.com/layer2/privacyweek\"><i><b>Privacy Week</b></i></a><i><b> series. J.P. Koning, a CoinDesk columnist, worked as an equity researcher at a Canadian brokerage firm and a financial writer at a large Canadian bank. He runs the popular Moneyness blog.</b></i>"},{"_id":"32SUBESF7FHLLPAYDR3O43OCQU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089492,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Imagine a cash-starved manufacturer in Toledo, Ohio, that has a good idea for a product. It could go to its banker for financing, but instead it turns to DeFi. In a jiffy, it tokenizes a bunch of receivables onto a blockchain and lodges them as collateral on a decentralized lending platform in return for U.S. dollar <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-a-stablecoin/\" target=\"_blank\">stablecoins</a>. A few moments later, it swaps these dollars for Euro stablecoins using a decentralized exchange, sending them to its French supplier to purchase inventory."},{"_id":"M3Y6ADHTJJFZBGMB6T4FU3NY54","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089493,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"This chain of transactions has the promise of being cheap, fast and avoiding the walled garden of regular banks. Unfortunately, our Toledo manufacturer probably wont bother."},{"_id":"WN75FU3F6NDPPFHG4J6KEMIFY4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089494,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"All blockchain transactions are public by default. The government, your competitors and your mother can all see what you are doing. Blockchain analytics firms like Chainalysis and CipherTrace make it their business to track, analyze and interpret every trade and transaction."},{"_id":"D4V2J6ZTXJH6FP2BNM5AC6CCL4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089495,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Secrecy is vital to commerce. Not only is it important for businesses to protect the privacy of their customers, they must also keep their competitors in the dark lest their long-term strategy be divined and countered or copied. Our Toledo manufacturer doesnt want its intentions to be telegraphed by their on-chain financial preparations."},{"_id":"KJ3CH52HXBHXHMPHNRYA75N2G4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089496,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"As for individuals, they don't want their friends and colleagues to know what their salary is, or what kinds of porn they're purchasing. No one wants to be doxxed. We like our secrets."},{"_id":"YLKXTAMI35C2LE7V6OZD5FGI6U","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089497,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Bricks-and-mortar finance is already capable of providing the secrecy that Main Street requires. Individuals and corporations generally trust their old-school bankers not to reveal information about their financial dealings to others. It's not quite cash-level anonymity. Yes, there are leaks and hacks. And under certain conditions, a banker must disclose information to law enforcement. But in general, Main Street trusts the confidentiality and probity of their financial provider."},{"_id":"JAP5CFPM2FBWXDZ55U4W5MVGME","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089498,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"So if Main Street users are ever going to migrate over to DeFi, privacy will have to be built first. But not just any privacy."},{"_id":"3LT35XTGJVFAJCSOO6Z562R7TA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089499,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2022/01/25/tornado-cash-co-founder-says-the-mixer-protocol-is-unstoppable/\">Tornado Cash</a> has become the DeFi world's go-to tool for achieving anonymity. A user can send funds to a Tornado Cash <a href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/smart-contracts.asp\" target=\"_blank\">smart contract</a> where it gets mixed up and obfuscated with other people's funds. Later, that user can surreptitiously withdraw the same amount of money to a separate address. A technology called <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/tag/zk-snarks/\" target=\"_blank\">zk-SNARKs</a> is used to reduce the ability of third parties to trace funds through Tornado."},{"_id":"ABD7DX6O5REBNIWBWOZVKAEQZY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089500,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Unfortunately, Tornado Cash has become a popular venue for thieves to clean stolen funds. The presence of criminals will make Main Street businesses like our Toledo-based manufacturer hesitate. Depositing company funds into a Tornado Cash smart contract may be construed as mixing them with criminally-derived funds. That's probably not the sort of money laundering risk that licit money wants to take."},{"_id":"AZIDBKDWFFBPBJHJQ2EV25FXEE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089501,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The best solution for bringing privacy to DeFi is native anonymity. That is, all blockchain transactions have to be opaque by default. That way, Main Street users get the privacy they require without having to take the risk of jumbling up their coins with crooks. (Approaches like the Aztec Network, a privacy layer implemented on top of the base <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/how-does-ethereum-work/\" target=\"_blank\">Ethereum</a> layer, might be a solution.)"},{"_id":"UO2IVFHSYFHVFNN5YX5MOX7K54","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089502,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"While native anonymity would solve Main Street's very real need for secrecy, it will lead to the next hurdle to widespread adoption: too much anonymity."},{"_id":"BVHINTIB3BBF7LFHIB5GG4SFPE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089503,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"If a Main Street financial user like our Toledo manufacturer can't risk tumbling their coins with dirty money on Tornado Cash, neither can they risk commingling their funds on decentralized exchanges or lending tools that grant unconditional access to everyone, including thieves' dirty funds."},{"_id":"V26CFY3XCFH53C2ZCRROUSAVRI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089504,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"To make their tools palatable for Main Street, DeFi tool makers will have to unwind some of the native anonymity (potentially) afforded by blockchains by collecting and verifying identifying information from users. This way the tools can screen out criminals, assuring legitimate businesses that their clean funds aren't being tainted by dirty money."},{"_id":"CWELMUWI6RGFFPVBDJWYWAA3B4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643318014582,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>Read more: </b></i><a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/layer2/privacyweek/2022/01/27/before-you-click-i-agree-how-binance-coinbase-and-22-other-crypto-exchanges-handle-your-data/\" target=\"_blank\"><i><b>How Binance, Coinbase and 22 Other Crypto Exchanges Handle Your Data</b></i></a>"},{"_id":"PRN22LFEWJC6LKXTBMG53L37BY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089505,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The implication is that DeFi tools will have to become privacy managers, just like old-school banks are. Users will have to trust the tools to be discreet with their personal information, only breaking their privacy when certain conditions are required, such as law enforcement requests."},{"_id":"GABBNDJGBJA4HEZZQNYOZVLUT4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089506,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Its possible that DeFi succeeds in doing a better job of preserving privacy than traditional financial institutions. By using <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/layer2/privacyweek/2022/01/24/the-trojan-horse-of-privacy/\">zero-knowledge proofs</a> for collecting identity, DeFi tools may be able to control the spray of personal information required to gain access. This may reduce the amount of information that gets lost to hacks."},{"_id":"MZMZIYE2EVHCHD5RQ5JY23PC3M","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089507,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"In sum, if DeFi wants to attract Main Street users, an odd mix of more secrecy and less secrecy is required. Secrecy is important to businesses and individuals. They dont want their information to be naked for all to see. But Main Street doesn't want complete anonymity. It wants to use DeFi tools that strip away just enough secrets to assure that dirty money is being excluded."},{"_id":"5P6JZBXTHNEZDDKUFSFN2AXUTQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1643317089508,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Only when this balance has been achieved will businesses like our Toledo, Ohio, manufacturer venture onto the blockchain."}],"created_date":"2022-01-27T17:22:51.344Z","last_updated_date":"2022-01-27T22:48:38.455Z","publish_date":"2022-01-27T22:48:38.137Z","first_publish_date":"2022-01-27T22:41:58.394Z","display_date":"2022-01-27T22:41:58.394Z","headlines":{"basic":"The Privacy That DeFi Needs to Succeed","meta_title":"","mobile":"","native":"","print":"","tablet":"","web":""},"subheadlines":{"basic":"Mainstream adoption of DeFi tools will require far more secrecy, but not too much secrecy, and the right sort of secrecy, says CoinDesk columnist J.P. Koning. This post is part of CoinDesk's Privacy Week. Or they can go for two and win the game outright."},{"_id":"FDJGVSLV4ZDSTD6PCRVTAHIYTQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658517968437,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>This piece is part of CoinDesk's Sports Week.</b></i>"},{"_id":"P7CDDZK6OBHYZF2GZEWKNDFYBY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569083,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"What do they do?"},{"_id":"ETUZ6LZFVRD3XIUEK7XVWMKZFE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569084,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Or, more accurately, what do you do?"},{"_id":"3X6T4UX45BD2XGNAPQ3WKOOJSA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569085,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Because you are part of the Chiefs DAO, or <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-a-dao/\" target=\"_blank\">decentralized autonomous organization</a>, you are technically a part-owner of the Chiefs. You get to help make decisions. So you grab your phone and cast your vote: Go for it."},{"_id":"NFGNAR5OGRCZLIIWNW5OJ3TFQM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569086,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Within seconds, thousands of other Chiefs owners/fans have just voted as well, and the Go for it crowd wins 57% to 43%."},{"_id":"CKIRE6LZKVBMPMTW4LLYEXTXBY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569087,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Mahomes snaps the ball  and lunges into the end zone on a QB sneak. Not only have your beloved Chiefs won the Super Bowl, but a tiny sliver of the teams revenue has just been zapped to your crypto wallet  as an owner, you share in the profits."},{"_id":"RZGRNFDOYNBKPBFSXSUIYIGVJA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569088,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Welcome to the world of Sports DAOs."},{"_id":"LF5APNWKMZEXVLQOYWXSZUZLCY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658514915525,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>Read More: </b></i><a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-a-dao/\"><i><b>What Is a DAO?</b></i></a>"},{"_id":"BJWLPLOVZRF3FPOHKMJJHOSNFQ","type":"header","level":2,"additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569092,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"BuytheBroncos"},{"_id":"KKLIQS36TZF2HHGPO5M2EYKJOQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569090,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"In a very literal sense, the above scenario is unlikely to ever become a reality. Its easier to imagine the Browns winning a Super Bowl than it is to see the NFL relinquishing game-time decisions to the fans. Thats more sci-fi than prediction."},{"_id":"43UPFIVKZFAGLCJUUJWGDRLQIQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569091,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"But in a deeper sense, its also true that there are several Sports DAO projects  with millions in their treasuries  that have ambitions to one day own a sports team. Some are long shots, some are imminent. And if these DAOs succeed, they could revolutionize the very nature of what it means to be a fan  or even a player."},{"_id":"BJWLPLOVZRF3FPOHKMJJHOSNFQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569092,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Fans are clamoring for the ability to not just be a fan, but to also have a voice, said Sean OBrien, co-founder of the DAO called BuytheBroncos that recently tried to, well, buy the Denver Broncos."},{"_id":"YWWT7DI7RNHLHOGSOC7XRL5RXY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569093,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Based in Utah, OBrien owns and runs a few small businesses with his wife  a mix of real estate, apparel and payment processing. He also dabbles in crypto. In 2021, he was intrigued by DAOs, as they seemed like the great equalizer that could help the little guys compete with the billionaires."},{"_id":"PJTSEIIRHBEWLAET4EHQNMIHXA","additional_properties":{"countryId":227,"fullSizeResizeUrl":"/resizer/dR6mSy_ZEkYIqg1HcdyXaQ-I26o=/arc-photo-coindesk/arc2-prod/public/PJTSEIIRHBEWLAET4EHQNMIHXA.jpg","galleries":[],"ingestionMethod":"manual","iptc_job_identifier":"775676469","iptc_source":"Getty OBrien said, given that longtime owner Pat Bowlen had passed away in 2019, and the team had since been run by a trust. We were pretty sure it would be in 2022."},{"_id":"JH6A5GFMTRAHVLMVM3FA7BXT4E","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569096,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"So OBrien did his homework. He knew the NFL and the Securities and Exchange Commission would be reluctant to acknowledge some goofy-sounding <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-web-3-and-why-is-everyone-talking-about-it/\" target=\"_blank\">Web3</a> entity, so along with longtime friend James Wigginton, he spent months developing the legal foundation. (OBrien has a J.D./MBA; Wigginton is a lawyer who worked for years at white-shoe law firm Sullivan & Cromwell.)"},{"_id":"4SFGXC2O3NHJDODQGCDR6UFFYM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658514915537,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>Read More: </b></i><a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-web-3-and-why-is-everyone-talking-about-it/\"><i><b>What Is Web 3 and Why Is Everyone Talking About It?</b></i></a>"},{"_id":"3O5VC22Y4ZHYNCCZDDNZCENKFI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569097,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Now they think they have one. As OBrien describes it, the NFL officially acknowledges five different types of ownership structures: independently wealthy individuals, an association, a partnership, a corporation or the fifth category of an other entity."},{"_id":"WEKBQOEPHBCMXJXWE636DLHP5A","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569098,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"They think the DAO can slide into the other category, because the DAO is a co-op. This is a solid legal framework, Wigginton said. Cooperatives have worked for hundreds of years. Farmers use co-ops. REI is a co-op. When you pay your $30 membership to REI, you are technically a part-owner and you receive year-end dividends when you buy tents and skis and sleeping bags. This could potentially revolutionize fan ownership, Wigginton said, because a cooperative  unlike a corporation  allows the users of the product to own the product."},{"_id":"WENZBZ7XAVFBJACFZWF2MAZX5Q","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569099,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"BuytheBroncos started with just OBrien and Wigginton. Once they realized it had legal legs (they vetted it with more lawyers and accountants), they began making calls and invited other to join  football fans, Web3 folk and even former NFL players. They started to grow. They began to get some press. We know it sounds a bit crazy, but its also a bit badass, OBrien <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/02/19/-buythebroncos-dao-aims-to-raise-4-billion-to-buy-denver-broncos.html\">told CNBC</a> in February. The purpose essentially is to establish an infrastructure so that fans from all walks of life can be owners of the Denver Broncos."},{"_id":"C3ZSNS7VIJBGPEKHILFVD3N52E","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569100,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Even high-profile fans began to listen. I would be excited to be part of it myself, Colorado Gov. Jared Polis said at ETHDenver in February. He acknowledged that the Broncos asking price (at least $4 billion) was daunting, but said that if your imagination is big enough, then it can happen. And anything I can do to make it happen, Id be happy to."},{"_id":"RC6MQIAEVRECDIRZPEMOLKLDAU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569101,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Others felt the same way. Roughly 1,000 people are now involved in BuytheBroncos, said OBrien  an unlikely mix of Web3 enthusiasts and football junkies. There are teenagers and old men. This has made it tricky to even agree upon a communication platform. There are some people who dont know what Discord is, and some people who [preferring encrypted channels] dont want to use text, said OBrien. When they first launched the DAOs website, the landing page said 'JERD,' for 'jocks and nerds unite.'"},{"_id":"7JBI5IU2CBBSHD5NZQMUMIFLYE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569102,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"So if OBrien succeeds, would fans be deciding whether the Broncos should kick the field goal or go for it on fourth down?"},{"_id":"NOWYGUAMDJGVXHL6RIAZ4WLARE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569103,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"OBrien sees zero chance of this, and its not part of his pitch or his vision. The DAO needs to be nurtured, he said, and several times he stressed that the goal is not to give fans real-time decision-making, or to let them help draft players or run the front office. At least for the moment, the DAO shouldnt interject itself in day-to-day operations, OBrien said. We dont want to be electing Russell Wilson to kick the PAT."},{"_id":"ZBRPYV77MJCW3IUR42LZMCPEDE","type":"quote","content_elements":[{"_id":"UQF7P2WRVBERTBSUYH5AWPLYS4","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The same thing that user generated content did for e-commerce, fan-generated content can do for sports teams.","type":"text"}],"subtype_label":"pullquote","citation":{"content":"","type":"text"},"subtype":"pullquote","additional_properties":{"_id":"IS253SHQ6NGVLPETF5YAP7VPRI","comments":[]}},{"_id":"JJ4O7T36QVAQDLVLBK4BTPHJEQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569104,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Fans might not be calling the plays, but in OBriens framework, theyll have more of a voice. Theyll have a seat at the table. If a team is considering leaving the city and relocating to Los Angeles? The fan/owners could vote that down."},{"_id":"TNFAPGZKO5AUFB2QIQY4CC62LM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569105,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The DAO could even empower NFL players. We havent made it public yet, but we have close to a dozen current Broncos who have said theyre onboard with us, OBrien said, along with a few dozen former NFL players. The pitch: If current NFL players are allowed to own a sliver of their team, this will both give them agency and boost their loyalty."},{"_id":"YNJAW6BFXFEMFBL3FOR3P4NTN4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569106,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Players would greatly appreciate owning a piece and having a small say, said Ben Garland over text, a retired 11-year NFL veteran and former Bronco. Garland has been helping pitch BuytheBroncos to other NFL players, and he says theres interest. Just about every player I talked to was excited about the possibility."},{"_id":"XIYRLDUD7BBIFFXUZWES2M3YRE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569107,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Garland thinks that a DAO would incentivize players both to come to a team and stay with a team. Which adds value to that team. He cites Tom Brady as an example. What if Brady, through a DAO, had a partial ownership of the Patriots in 2019? Its hard to imagine him bolting for the Buccaneers. I would want to end my career with the team I owned, Garland wrote, instead of selling my ownership and moving to another team for the last few years of my career."},{"_id":"6W64YLW6NVAIPPGGB67DIBD4T4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569108,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The Brady example isnt even that hypothetical. As OBrien points out, when Brady briefly retired in February, there was speculation that he almost joined the Dolphins  arch-rival of the Patriots!  just to get a slice of ownership once he retired. The man controls every room he walks into, said OBrien, but even a post-retirement partial ownership was almost enough to get him to go there."},{"_id":"4JK6LGZMT5E6FB6RUMS7KSNQMU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569109,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"But then theres reality."},{"_id":"O4UII6JKYFEZVCJXPPRRA5NPFQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569110,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"NFL franchises, of course, are not cheap. And on June 7, the Broncos announced they had reached a deal to sell the team to the Walton-Penner family, which includes Walmart heir Rob Walton and company chairman Greg Penner, for $4.65 billion."},{"_id":"BC5XR6FEERHZPPPAIURCF3LZD4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569111,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"OBrien was not prepared to go on the record with how much the DAO has raised, but he acknowledged it was nowhere close to $4.65 billion."},{"_id":"CAHEIZM7HNDNFFYCXVCVEF44F4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569112,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The dream looked dead. group of 5,300 golf enthusiasts who are trying to buy a golf course. Were rethinking the concept of what a golf community can be, said Jim Daily, the DAOs founder (along with Mike Dudas), who views the DAO as a way to make the exclusive world of golf more fun and inclusive and egalitarian."},{"_id":"4YUVU4Z46NBVBNDFHRJUEG62MM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569119,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"LinksDAO has $9 million in the treasury, according to Daily, which was raised through a non-fungible token (<a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-are-nfts-and-how-do-they-work/\" target=\"_blank\">NFT</a>) drop that sold out in less than 48 hours. So unlike the more quixotic quest of buying an NFL team, a DAO-infused golf course feels likely to happen. (Daily clarifies that they will not use the DAOs treasury to purchase the course, but instead do an equity raise with more traditional capital, and that in a technical sense, the DAO members will not actually own the course.)"},{"_id":"OLDGWG7XGBHJPCJNLOLROPNGXQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658514915561,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>Read More: </b></i><a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/layer2/futureofworkweek/2022/07/01/daos-are-the-new-way-of-impact-work/\" target=\"_blank\"><i><b>DAOs Are the New Way of Impact Work</b></i></a>"},{"_id":"HL57SX7CE5CZ7ODGM7YEIMRWMU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569120,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Daily, who now spends much of his time humping around the country looking at golf courses, said the DAO is an easy way for golfers to nerd out over golf. Its a way to find your tribe. (A tribe that might now include  <a href=\"https://twitter.com/LinksDAO/status/1547947516955484160?s=20&t=chj8zQ2Yev12U1lj37FlAQ\">Bill Murray?</a>) If youre a golfer, you play the game for life, Daily said, and there are so many different areas where you can really lean in with other people. The community obsesses over things like the optimal putting technique, clubs, accessories, coaching and the best courses to play. Just ask any nongolfer whos forced to listen to other golfers talk about golf  it can be insufferable."},{"_id":"UDEIQCGNEFC4HIC42G7UE4OE74","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569121,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Then there are the real-life benefits. Through partnerships with high-end apparel companies such as Holderness & Bourne and Devereux Threads, members get immediate discounts in the real world. Not just in the future. This is happening today. At TopGolf locations throughout the U.S., members get discounts on food and drinks. One of our LinksDAO members had $2,600 worth of value in partnerships, Daily said. And this has only been around for six months. (OBrien has a similar vision for BuytheBroncos, which would give perks to the fans/owners: discounts on Broncos merchandise, early access to seats at the game and digital goodies in the <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2021/08/03/a-crypto-guide-to-the-metaverse/\" target=\"_blank\">metaverse</a>.)"},{"_id":"ZHFNH4DQC5BHXPI3EJAAQ44U3E","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569122,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"With the NFL, OBrien has worked hard to distance BuytheBroncos from the zanier idea that fans will control real-time granular decisions. Democracy doesnt equal chaos, he said. Just because you have a DAO cooperative doesnt mean there are 10,000 people sitting in the room deciding whether we turn the AC to 71 degrees."},{"_id":"2OV6QMX3YZG7FFZQTHCSCERX2I","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569123,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"LinksDAO, in contrast, is leaning into the idea of fans controlling the decision-making. Thats part of the fun. Every question of the courses strategy and management could be decided by the DAO. Should they redesign the course, and if so, what architect do they choose? What are the rules for the clubhouse? How much are the fees? In LinksDAOs Discord, members are already brainstorming ways to give the course a Web3 twist. One inspired or ridiculous idea is to install constantly running cameras on the par-3 holes, and if you get a hole-in-one it automatically mints you a hole-in-one NFT."},{"_id":"3K4NS5DQOZCN7DVC3YC5OZVLKI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569124,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"LinksDAO is not the only sports DAO to embrace the more sweeping potential of granular decision-making by fans."},{"_id":"TN6TC2ZIFVB4VC4ICFY35HBUAU","type":"header","level":2,"additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569125,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Wanna buy a yacht?"},{"_id":"DMY7QKBVCREQJP7O3WV5K2UFKM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569126,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The sailing league SailGP, founded by Larry Ellison, co-founder and chairman of Oracle, is working with the Near blockchain protocol to offer the sale of a team through a DAO."},{"_id":"4FGUQIHS2FHDNN7PSFRIIFKBLY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569127,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The average person cant afford to buy a yacht. But if thousands of people pool their resources? Suddenly the barrier to entry is lowered. And then they can start calling the shots: Who captains the crew, how much the team should get paid, which sponsors to use, which nations flag (if any) should unfurl from the boat and how to upgrade and tweak the yacht. The DAO could pick the sponsorships. Do you want, for example, Philip Morris on the boat? You might not, and you can have a say in that, said Chris Ghent, global head of brand strategy and partnerships at the Near Images","country_name":"United States"},{"_id":"QRJSNIET4RB7LFWZHMSVA7MXUM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569128,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Then the DAO could make even more granular decisions. Ghent says that in every sailing race, each day, the boats provide 8 billion data points that can be analyzed. This fire hose of data includes second-by-second variables like wind speeds, crew decisions and pressure on the trampoline. The DAO could monitor and react to this data in real time. When you think about the ability to swap players out, is that possible? Absolutely, said Ghent. Or perhaps the DAO makes a snap-decision vote on what the crew should do, and then thats an advisory input thats shared with the coach. All of these scenarios are up to the discretion of the DAO."},{"_id":"QCYST7GKYJCEPOI2IH4ZIPSVNY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569129,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Ghent says that SailGP has worked with lawyers at Proskauer Rose to hammer out the legal framework. Were only months away from the beginning of this, said Ghent, who predicts that a DAO-owned yacht will enter the waters in 2023."},{"_id":"4VMZZJPXIJEEHO3C6TRANJKPXU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569130,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The SailGP DAO, like LinksDAO, feels imminent. But theres one SportsDAO thats already up and running."},{"_id":"4K6R5RYKAZH3BDZD3BJYTT4RHQ","type":"header","level":2,"additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569131,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Ball Hogs"},{"_id":"5F3HBJ7IUZGTPJNH6BLSXTRPGU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569132,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The pseudonymous Flex Chapman is a 30-something software engineer whos a lifelong basketball fan and player; he once played in the AAU against the likes of Kevin Durant and Dwight Howard. (He clarifies that he didnt stand a chance of playing in the NBA.) In May of 2021, purely as an experiment, Chapman decided to launch Krause DAO, with the name a cheeky reference to longtime former Bulls General Manager Jerry Krause."},{"_id":"XF76MAYFHJCBTCQN64CY2Q23U4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569133,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Krause DAO had a simple goal: Were a community of hoop fanatics crazy enough to buy an NBA team. As Chapman wrote in the projects white paper (or hype paper), Team ownership shouldnt be limited to a handful of billionaires, but rather a movement of individuals that want to be a part of the greatest professional league in the world."},{"_id":"JCM3CVUAYJFDDGNOQZNB6XD62A","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569134,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Then Chapman articulates the logic that undergirds all of these Sports DAOs: Fans breed life to the organizations in which they attach, so isn't it reasonable to accept a shared portion of the ownership and upside? We don't think it's merely acceptable, but mandatory."},{"_id":"IBCNXLXMKZEZ5OME2S7RPISKGY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569135,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The growth rate of these DAOs is astonishing, even by the standards of crypto. When I first wrote about DAOs in the fall of 2021 (reporting on how the exchange <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/08/18/shapeshift-daos-and-the-future-of-work/\">ShapeShift had converted into a DAO</a>), I first noticed KrauseDAO and dismissed it as a joke; at the time it only had 392 members. Mea culpa. KrauseDAOs membership has swelled to 7,000. Thanks to a lucrative NFT sale, it now has a treasury of more than $4 million."},{"_id":"FDQ5CXP5LJHXVLEVAAEWMYLLGY","type":"quote","content_elements":[{"_id":"BRWPJ3ZGOBF4XIV6CE7FXC3PWE","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Its going to happen. Someones going to do it.","type":"text"}],"subtype_label":"pullquote","citation":{"content":"","type":"text"},"subtype":"pullquote","additional_properties":{"_id":"XVR6MHXL2NC4PGGW54GHG7YKY4","comments":[]}},{"_id":"GD62N7HYGVEGXM7T6SL7DLW2TA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569136,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"It costs a lot more than $4 million, of course, to purchase an NBA team. (In 2019, the Brooklyn Nets sold for $3.3 billion.) But KrauseDAO actually owns a basketball team. The DAO purchased a team called the Ball Hogs, which plays in a more casual three-on-three league, the Big 3, that was founded by Ice Cube."},{"_id":"I67MYURVHJCYBJ7OSH2KW272OA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658514915579,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>Podcast: </b></i><a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/podcasts/opinionated/taking-the-nba-to-the-next-level-with-dao-ownership/\" target=\"_blank\"><i><b>Taking the NBA to the Next Level With DAO Ownership</b></i></a>"},{"_id":"PHLNWQEQ6ZA6BFSWGCJTBXXNPM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569137,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The Big 3 is entertaining. Its packed with former NBA All-Stars (like Joe Johnson and Baron Davis) and has a 4-point shot. Big 3s motto is were changing the game, which makes it the ideal testing ground for a Sports DAO."},{"_id":"6J3CQ3HI35DOFJ2MFAFRUF3QSU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569138,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"KrauseDAO has already put the collective hive to use, such as sending a scouting report to their coach, NBA Hall of Famer Rick Barry, breaking down their upcoming opponents strengths (including rebounds per game, steals and blocks per game) and weaknesses (such as 3-point shooting). Thanks for the breakdown, Barry texted back. This is very helpful."},{"_id":"6K3P5L6WBZBLHAAM6TUM4S5B4M","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569139,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"We want to add value not only to the team, but also the players, Chapman said. This could mean getting them new sponsorships. Chapman said that when power forward Stacy Davis casually mentioned he enjoys Lara protein bars, the members of KrauseDAO used their connections and landed him a sponsorship deal."},{"_id":"ZJE2YR6ZIJDEDCSZIKR5Q6GFJE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569140,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"But Chapman realizes there are limits to what the DAO can realistically do. When he first hatched the idea, his little kid brain loved the idea of fans getting to act as general managers who signed and cut players, made all the roster decisions and commanded the draft-night war room."},{"_id":"E6C7TNDCNRFCJDYLFNIRYDRZIA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569141,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The more Chapman dug into what actually happens at NBA front offices, he realized that a general managers job is way more high-touch and about personal relationships than one would think. That was a bummer to hear."},{"_id":"ROM2RMMLWFEDRFFAITRNMQOO7Q","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569142,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"But there are other ways that a DAO-infused fanbase can contribute. The way that NBA teams scout for international players, Chapman said, is still at times rudimentary, or a lot like scouting in the 70s, where its simply impossible to canvas the entire globe for talent. Teams have finite budgets. What if you could tap into a network of amateur scouts thats free, decentralized and able to reach even the most remote gyms in Cambodia? We could have people all over the world, said Chapman. Even if these are not professionally trained scouts, at the very least they could record footage of the games, or perhaps take notes on players body language. Chapman said he described this idea to an NBA executive and their eyes widened."},{"_id":"W3AEIWRLANAZHME3Q5Z4AAH3BU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569143,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"DAO fan/owners could bring a team more content. The same thing that user generated content did for e-commerce, fan-generated content can do for sports teams, Chapman said. Every team should be their own Bleacher Report, or be their own ESPN. The reason this doesnt happen now, he said, is because teams lack the bandwidth; some front offices employ only seven people. Theyre all busy and they might not have time to launch a new media vertical. Theres no reason why the Warriors shouldnt have four podcasts, three YouTube channels, and a TikTok account, Chapman said. A DAO could organize its energy and help make that happen."},{"_id":"UI3ENGPNVRCP7BNOONYL3JI75Y","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569144,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"On a more philosophical note, Chapman sees the DAO as a way to empower the fan. To give them agency. Fans are like the atomic unit of the NBA, he said. Fans are the reasons the stadium is so big. Fans are why franchises are worth billions of dollars. Fans are why the NBA is in business, but they are typically viewed as fungible assets, he said. Everyone is wearing the same colors in the stadium. They come and clap for an hour or two and they go home."},{"_id":"UXMOR6SI6BBD3LYDFJQ7DZYAL4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569145,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Chapman considers the historic model of fandom as value extractive  fans are just leeched as consumers of popcorn and jerseys and ticket sales. But they have more to offer. Theres this nuclear energy sitting in the stadium, said Chapman. The people who are going to the games are lawyers and marketers and software engineers. With the DAO, fans can harness their abilities to help the team win. Our goal is to build that conduit, he noted. This conduit would help fans contribute to their team not just financially, but through their own work and creativity, to help them win more games and more championships."},{"_id":"FUPF6MPUMRDLTFJVELKZOZQUMM","type":"header","level":2,"additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569146,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Its going to happen"},{"_id":"OXYARUCLS5C6XEIVFKTIIHYDHU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569147,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"It does not, as of this writing, appear that Sean OBrien will miraculously pony up $4.6 billion dollars to buy the Broncos."},{"_id":"UH7HPHXZWREVNODMRIAN2ZYIII","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569148,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"But theres a twist to this story. BuytheBroncos does not need to purchase 100% of a team to succeed. Raising $4.6 billion might be a stretch, but what about $460 million, or enough to snag a 10% slice? Or even $230 million for a 5% chunk? Given that the ConstitutionDAO raised <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2021/11/19/after-being-foiled-by-a-billionaire-constitutiondao-faces-lingering-questions/\">$47 million in seven days</a>, a sum of $230 million is not inconceivable."},{"_id":"5UAVQEJXVZHXJLCFUJRE3OIRNI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569149,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"This has not been reported by the press (to my knowledge), but BuytheBroncos has quietly been meeting with the other suitors of the Broncos, hoping to join their bid as a minority partner. What if the combination of Suitor B and BuytheBroncos DAO could outbid the Walton family?"},{"_id":"55QTHGV5I5FK5NLFIJPVIADUBY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569150,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"That was OBriens hope. Being pragmatic, the better play was to align ourselves with these other bidders, he said. He was surprised by the June 7 announcement that the Broncos were selling to the Walton-Penner family. He thought the bidding process would last for another few weeks, and he had planned to use that time to hit the green button and go more public to raise capital. Until we could confidently say that we had an agreement in place to be a partial owner, we wanted to hold off on the public side of the raise, said OBrien."},{"_id":"RW35MYQCZNEPTIK77OWXDEAKKA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569151,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The idea of the DAO as a partial NFL owner might be less colorful than you calling the Chiefs play at the end of the Super Bowl, but it still has the potential to revolutionize the NFL, or at least NFL fandom. And the idea might even be embraced by unlikely allies: NFL owners."},{"_id":"4JUBHAIG6BE2FFOR2GVJDPNMFQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569152,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"True, its hard to imagine NFL owners  a group of wealthy old men  caring about the decentralized principles of Web3. But its easy to see them caring about money. A lot of money. As OBrien sees it, if Jerry Jones wanted to open up, say, a 20% ownership stake to a Cowboys DAO, he would put $2 billion in his pocket overnight, and he would have the most rabidly loyal fans."},{"_id":"TQRVTBJWZFB6NP3SRV4XHWMN5E","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569153,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Or look at the Green Bay Packers. They are the only team in the league thats owned by the fans: 360,584 stockholders. It cant be a coincidence that this is one of the most loyal fan bases in the NFL, even if all the owners can really do is proudly hang stock certificates on the wall. The sun will explode and life on Earth will cease to exist before the Green Bay Packers move out of Green Bay, OBrien said. Thats how all teams should be, essentially. Every current owner could open up 10%, 15% or 20% of their ownership stake, put immediate liquidity in their pocket, and become gods in their respective cities."},{"_id":"KCXNIXS7CVC6NCBKESJK4PYACE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569154,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"This is why even if OBrien fails in the bid to outright buy the Broncos  that seems inevitable  hes confident that the framework of a DAO is so logical, so compelling and so lucrative that its bound to catch on somewhere. Teams from every major sports league in this country have reached out to us, said OBrien. That includes the MLB, NHL, NBA and the MLS, in addition to the NFL."},{"_id":"WFAN4OG5EBD4BG6LJ6ALY2AHKQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569155,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"OBrien knew that buying the Broncos was a long shot. He knew that by going first he faced stiff resistance. Its kind of like how the first person through the door always gets shot, he said. We knew we were going to get shot in a lot of ways. But hes confident that the DAO can be a blueprint for the future. Maybe for another NFL team. Maybe for the NBA."},{"_id":"7B5H53H7I5BXXHZJ62YTKRNVRA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569156,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Its going to happen, OBrien said. Someones going to do it."}],"created_date":"2022-07-22T17:30:10.260Z","revision":{"revision_id":"A5IYREE7ZZDLHOIT3T3P6YCYVQ","parent_id":"5YP56IQNHVCZVINDG7X2OWXZV4","editions":["default"],"branch":"default","user_id":"ben@coindesk.com","published":true},"last_updated_date":"2022-07-25T14:11:40.087Z","headlines":{"basic":"For the Fans: How DAOs Could Change Sports","meta_title":"For the Fans: How Web3 DAOs Could Change Sports","mobile":"","native":"","print":"","tablet":"","web":"For the Fans: How Web3 DAOs Could Change Sports"},"owner":{"sponsored":false,"id":"coindesk"},"address":{},"workflow":{"status_code":1},"subheadlines":{"basic":"Experiments with decentralized autonomous organizations promise greater fan participation in sports teams. of crypto exchange FTX, and Jump Crypto, according to a press decentralized music streaming platform provides artists with greater profits and increased control, Bank of America (BAC) said in a research report Thursday."},{"_id":"EUPJMD5ARFEZNNZOA5XFUBMZQM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Audius launched its mainnet in October 2020 with the aim of shifting the balance of power and profits from intermediaries, such as record labels and centralized DSPs [digital service providers] to artists and platform users, the report said."},{"_id":"WWZDMBYR6FDODJ7VBDNXU2EW4U","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The platform plans to distribute 90% of revenues to artists and 10% to node operators by removing intermediaries, which results in a decentralized DSP that shifts power, profits, control and governance from record labels and centralized DSPs to artists and fans, the note said."},{"_id":"7Y7EBYCDSND6RNGIS7FN2M3QCA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The streaming service <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/business/2022/07/19/blockchain-music-service-audius-to-allow-users-to-tip-artists-using-audio/\">said last week</a> that it was offering a new feature for creators to monetize their content by allowing listeners to send tips to artists via its governance token AUDIO."},{"_id":"I4FXOVYCLBHDFEKYCDDZUOEQF4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Bank of America says the music industry is ripe for disruption. Still, Audius adoption trends and limited music offering relative to larger DSPs are likely to limit short-term disruption risk, however, disruption over the longer term is still possible."},{"_id":"IRO22FMSX5F6RJ4LCUYC6DKIFA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Competition is an issue, as leading DSPs have built economic moats around their businesses by offering large music offerings through record labels and by leveraging personal data to improve the user experience, the note said. Smaller DSPs, such as Audius, are faced with a Catch-22 scenario, as user adoption is needed to push artists onto their platform but it also needs artists to join to drive user adoption, it added."},{"_id":"HFMH74S4PZDPBBKTQPES6VGGJY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The bank notes that while Audius platform has attracted mainstream artists, including deadmau5, Diplo, Skrillex and Weezer, its usage growth has slowed since December 2021."},{"_id":"TFZPD2FLWRBJPFN7JZWL2UXQ3I","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"There are also potential legal risks related to Audiuss inability to remove music that infringes on copyright that should not be ignored, the note added."},{"_id":"OA4CPEZGCJDYXLUCBZDS5FKVYQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The <a The Chiefs just scored to pull within a point."},{"_id":"CS7T747WDBELDDF7AWM5YCKDIM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569081,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Now they have a choice."},{"_id":"5SCA7MLBEFGAFPHUWR4ZOKFKWE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569082,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"They could kick the PAT, tie the game, and try their luck in overtime. Or they can go for two and win the game outright."},{"_id":"FDJGVSLV4ZDSTD6PCRVTAHIYTQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658517968437,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>This piece is part of CoinDesk's Sports Week.</b></i>"},{"_id":"P7CDDZK6OBHYZF2GZEWKNDFYBY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569083,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"What do they do?"},{"_id":"ETUZ6LZFVRD3XIUEK7XVWMKZFE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569084,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Or, more accurately, what do you do?"},{"_id":"3X6T4UX45BD2XGNAPQ3WKOOJSA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569085,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Because you are part of the Chiefs DAO, or <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-a-dao/\" target=\"_blank\">decentralized autonomous organization</a>, you are technically a part-owner of the Chiefs. You get to help make decisions. So you grab your phone and cast your vote: Go for it."},{"_id":"NFGNAR5OGRCZLIIWNW5OJ3TFQM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569086,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Within seconds, thousands of other Chiefs owners/fans have just voted as well, and the Go for it crowd wins 57% to 43%."},{"_id":"CKIRE6LZKVBMPMTW4LLYEXTXBY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569087,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Mahomes snaps the ball  and lunges into the end zone on a QB sneak. He wins. The Chiefs win. You win. Not only have your beloved Chiefs won the Super Bowl, but a tiny sliver of the teams revenue has just been zapped to your crypto wallet  as an owner, you share in the profits."},{"_id":"RZGRNFDOYNBKPBFSXSUIYIGVJA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569088,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Welcome to the world of Sports DAOs."},{"_id":"LF5APNWKMZEXVLQOYWXSZUZLCY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658514915525,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>Read More: </b></i><a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-a-dao/\"><i><b>What Is a DAO?</b></i></a>"},{"_id":"BJWLPLOVZRF3FPOHKMJJHOSNFQ","type":"header","level":2,"additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569092,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"BuytheBroncos"},{"_id":"KKLIQS36TZF2HHGPO5M2EYKJOQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569090,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"In a very literal sense, the above scenario is unlikely to ever become a reality. Its easier to imagine the Browns winning a Super Bowl than it is to see the NFL relinquishing game-time decisions to the fans. Thats more sci-fi than prediction."},{"_id":"43UPFIVKZFAGLCJUUJWGDRLQIQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569091,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"But in a deeper sense, its also true that there are several Sports DAO projects  with millions in their treasuries  that have ambitions to one day own a sports team. Some are long shots, some are imminent. And if these DAOs succeed, they could revolutionize the very nature of what it means to be a fan  or even a player."},{"_id":"BJWLPLOVZRF3FPOHKMJJHOSNFQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569092,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Fans are clamoring for the ability to not just be a fan, but to also have a voice, said Sean OBrien, co-founder of the DAO called BuytheBroncos that recently tried to, well, buy the Denver Broncos."},{"_id":"YWWT7DI7RNHLHOGSOC7XRL5RXY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569093,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Based in Utah, OBrien owns and runs a few small businesses with his wife  a mix of real estate, apparel and payment processing. He also dabbles in crypto. In 2021, he was intrigued by DAOs, as they seemed like the great equalizer that could help the little guys compete with the billionaires."},{"_id":"PJTSEIIRHBEWLAET4EHQNMIHXA","additional_properties":{"countryId":227,"fullSizeResizeUrl":"/resizer/dR6mSy_ZEkYIqg1HcdyXaQ-I26o=/arc-photo-coindesk/arc2-prod/public/PJTSEIIRHBEWLAET4EHQNMIHXA.jpg","galleries":[],"ingestionMethod":"manual","iptc_job_identifier":"775676469","iptc_source":"Getty he had a wild idea."},{"_id":"C2NKZS25E5HYJDK3FDQFOPMXSM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569095,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"We knew the Broncos would be going up for sale, OBrien said, given that longtime owner Pat Bowlen had passed away in 2019, and the team had since been run by a trust. We were pretty sure it would be in 2022."},{"_id":"JH6A5GFMTRAHVLMVM3FA7BXT4E","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569096,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"So OBrien did his homework. He knew the NFL and the Securities and Exchange Commission would be reluctant to acknowledge some goofy-sounding <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-web-3-and-why-is-everyone-talking-about-it/\" target=\"_blank\">Web3</a> entity, so along with longtime friend James Wigginton, he spent months developing the legal foundation. (OBrien has a J.D./MBA; Wigginton is a lawyer who worked for years at white-shoe law firm Sullivan & Cromwell.)"},{"_id":"4SFGXC2O3NHJDODQGCDR6UFFYM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658514915537,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i><b>Read More: </b></i><a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/learn/what-is-web-3-and-why-is-everyone-talking-about-it/\"><i><b>What Is Web 3 and Why Is Everyone Talking About It?</b></i></a>"},{"_id":"3O5VC22Y4ZHYNCCZDDNZCENKFI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569097,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Now they think they have one. As OBrien describes it, the NFL officially acknowledges five different types of ownership structures: independently wealthy individuals, an association, a partnership, a corporation or the fifth category of an other entity."},{"_id":"WEKBQOEPHBCMXJXWE636DLHP5A","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569098,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"They think the DAO can slide into the other category, because the DAO is a co-op. This is a solid legal framework, Wigginton said. Cooperatives have worked for hundreds of years. Farmers use co-ops. REI is a co-op. When you pay your $30 membership to REI, you are technically a part-owner and you receive year-end dividends when you buy tents and skis and sleeping bags. This could potentially revolutionize fan ownership, Wigginton said, because a cooperative  unlike a corporation  allows the users of the product to own the product."},{"_id":"WENZBZ7XAVFBJACFZWF2MAZX5Q","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569099,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"BuytheBroncos started with just OBrien and Wigginton. Once they realized it had legal legs (they vetted it with more lawyers and accountants), they began making calls and invited other to join  football fans, Web3 folk and even former NFL players. They started to grow. They began to get some press. We know it sounds a bit crazy, but its also a bit badass, OBrien <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/02/19/-buythebroncos-dao-aims-to-raise-4-billion-to-buy-denver-broncos.html\">told CNBC</a> in February. The purpose essentially is to establish an infrastructure so that fans from all walks of life can be owners of the Denver Broncos."},{"_id":"C3ZSNS7VIJBGPEKHILFVD3N52E","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569100,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Even high-profile fans began to listen. I would be excited to be part of it myself, Colorado Gov. Jared Polis said at ETHDenver in February. He acknowledged that the Broncos asking price (at least $4 billion) was daunting, but said that if your imagination is big enough, then it can happen. And anything I can do to make it happen, Id be happy to."},{"_id":"RC6MQIAEVRECDIRZPEMOLKLDAU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569101,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Others felt the same way. Roughly 1,000 people are now involved in BuytheBroncos, said OBrien  an unlikely mix of Web3 enthusiasts and football junkies. There are teenagers and old men. This has made it tricky to even agree upon a communication platform. There are some people who dont know what Discord is, and some people who [preferring encrypted channels] dont want to use text, said OBrien. When they first launched the DAOs website, the landing page said 'JERD,' for 'jocks and nerds unite.'"},{"_id":"7JBI5IU2CBBSHD5NZQMUMIFLYE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569102,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"So if OBrien succeeds, would fans be deciding whether the Broncos should kick the field goal or go for it on fourth down?"},{"_id":"NOWYGUAMDJGVXHL6RIAZ4WLARE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569103,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"OBrien sees zero chance of this, and its not part of his pitch or his vision. The DAO needs to be nurtured, he said, and several times he stressed that the goal is not to give fans real-time decision-making, or to let them help draft players or run the front office. At least for the moment, the DAO shouldnt interject itself in day-to-day operations, OBrien said. We dont want to be electing Russell Wilson to kick the PAT."},{"_id":"ZBRPYV77MJCW3IUR42LZMCPEDE","type":"quote","content_elements":[{"_id":"UQF7P2WRVBERTBSUYH5AWPLYS4","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The same thing that user generated content did for e-commerce, fan-generated content can do for sports teams.","type":"text"}],"subtype_label":"pullquote","citation":{"content":"","type":"text"},"subtype":"pullquote","additional_properties":{"_id":"IS253SHQ6NGVLPETF5YAP7VPRI","comments":[]}},{"_id":"JJ4O7T36QVAQDLVLBK4BTPHJEQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569104,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Fans might not be calling the plays, but in OBriens framework, theyll have more of a voice. Theyll have a seat at the table. If a team is considering leaving the city and relocating to Los Angeles? The fan/owners could vote that down."},{"_id":"TNFAPGZKO5AUFB2QIQY4CC62LM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569105,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The DAO could even empower NFL players. We havent made it public yet, but we have close to a dozen current Broncos who have said theyre onboard with us, OBrien said, along with a few dozen former NFL players. The pitch: If current NFL players are allowed to own a sliver of their team, this will both give them agency and boost their loyalty."},{"_id":"YNJAW6BFXFEMFBL3FOR3P4NTN4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569106,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Players would greatly appreciate owning a piece and having a small say, said Ben Garland over text, a retired 11-year NFL veteran and former Bronco. Garland has been helping pitch BuytheBroncos to other NFL players, and he says theres interest. Just about every player I talked to was excited about the possibility."},{"_id":"XIYRLDUD7BBIFFXUZWES2M3YRE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569107,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Garland thinks that a DAO would incentivize players both to come to a team and stay with a team. Which adds value to that team. He cites Tom Brady as an example. What if Brady, through a DAO, had a partial ownership of the Patriots in 2019? Its hard to imagine him bolting for the Buccaneers. I would want to end my career with the team I owned, Garland wrote, instead of selling my ownership and moving to another team for the last few years of my career."},{"_id":"6W64YLW6NVAIPPGGB67DIBD4T4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569108,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The Brady example isnt even that hypothetical. As OBrien points out, when Brady briefly retired in February, there was speculation that he almost joined the Dolphins  arch-rival of the Patriots!  just to get a slice of ownership once he retired. The man controls every room he walks into, said OBrien, but even a post-retirement partial ownership was almost enough to get him to go there."},{"_id":"4JK6LGZMT5E6FB6RUMS7KSNQMU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569109,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"But then theres reality."},{"_id":"O4UII6JKYFEZVCJXPPRRA5NPFQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569110,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"NFL franchises, of course, are not cheap. And on June 7, the Broncos announced they had reached a deal to sell the team to the Walton-Penner family, which includes Walmart heir Rob Walton and company chairman Greg Penner, for $4.65 billion."},{"_id":"BC5XR6FEERHZPPPAIURCF3LZD4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569111,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"OBrien was not prepared to go on the record with how much the DAO has raised, but he acknowledged it was nowhere close to $4.65 billion."},{"_id":"CAHEIZM7HNDNFFYCXVCVEF44F4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1658512569112,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The dream looked dead.
